fields.description: Readers, writers and admins are shown with just a username. Identifying them would be easier if the full name was shown (if applicable), and (optionally) their email address.
fields.summary: Additional details about users on repo admin page

fields.description: Or at least an option for a link.  I'm using it (http://twitter.com/ianbcommits) and it doesn't look right without links.
fields.summary: Twitter service should include a link

fields.description:
I get fork notifications and most of the time I can't figure out what the purpose of the fork is (nicer users name their fork something other than the name of the original repository, to clarify).

Asking for some reason for the fork would give useful information.
fields.summary: Ask "why are you making this fork?" (BB-673)

fields.description: Forks that haven't had any commits, or where all commits have been pulled into their parent, are boring.  But they aren't easy to distinguish from interesting forks.  Some UI to distinguish between these two states would be nice.
fields.summary: Make boring forks clearly boring (BB-336)

fields.description: When there is a big diff, bitbucket does not display it ("This changeset can not be displayed, as it is too large") But it should at least be possible to click the filenames and get a diff for the single file then IMHO.
fields.summary: No way to view big diffs

fields.description: I do not see a means for updating CC info in our account panel.
fields.summary: updating credit card for our plan

fields.description: Oct. 25 was the last time email was received by any of the users (4) on any of my repos. The email addresses are geographically dispersed and use 3 different SMTPDs to receive the mail. So far all email stopped at all locations at the same time.
fields.summary: Users no longer receive email upon new issue creation

fields.description: I have 2 repos: one repo is the application source the other is the backend DB work the application uses during development. It would be great to be able to create issues that reference issues in another repo using a syntax like: <<repo:issue #>> or something similar.
fields.summary: Reference issues between 2 repos using extended syntax (BB-753)

fields.description: Since not long ago, newlines are no longer displayed correctly in the changesets' descriptions in the Changesets and Source view. They are displayed as one space.
fields.summary: Newlines displayed incorrectly in changeset descriptions

fields.description:
I found the upgrade from 0.3 to 0.5 but now find that the PDF file is quite plain. There isa no option file for size of font etc. I am not a professional so can not make modifications to compiled progs.

Mike.yarnold@tiscali.co.uk
fields.summary: No preferences option in PC 32 bit version

fields.description: link for TortoiseHg misspelt as TortoiseHG so download for English PDF documentation fails.
fields.summary: bad documemtation link

fields.description:
I forked a private repository from a client today. I was sure it would be kept private since  "Private repository" was pre-selected and unchangeable. But then my fork was publicly visible without a further warning.

I suspect that it would have been kept private if I wouldn't of already had used my private repository on my free plan.

* it was not clear that forking a private repository would count as a private repo on my account
* there was no warning or indication that the repo would become public. The fact that "Private repository" was selected was very misleading.
fields.summary: No warning that private repository becomes public after fork

fields.description:
I am Windows, Russian user. Use tortoisehg. I create file wit name on my native russian language, and commit and sync to server.

If i try see commit detail i get 500 internal error

For sample you can see:

http://bitbucket.org/apochekutov/public/changeset/823e2db339bb/

Thanks!
fields.summary: Not aviable russian file name (BB-744)

fields.description: Unicode characters in file names are not supported? ñ á, etc.
fields.summary: No Unicode support? (BB-744)

fields.description: So...I've been wondering about this for a while now:
fields.summary: Why are the login fields at the top?  There's no way to actually use them...

fields.description: I'm using an offsite (pre-existing) issue tracker, and I'd like it to be natural and obvious where it is.  Ideally I'd like to be able to add an Issues tab (in the usual location) that would link over to the issue tracker site.  Drop-down, return navigation, etc, isn't really that important if I can just get the link in a familiar place.
fields.summary: Custom tabs for a repository

fields.description: I'd like to put wiki markup in the project description (mostly for nicer links), but that doesn't appear to work.
fields.summary: Repository description should accept wiki markup
Ordered List with unordered sublist intendation (BB-748)

fields.description:
See the attached screenshots.

Check out the difference between line 8 (in Picture 2.jpg) and look how it's rendered in the changelog display (in Picture 1.jpg).
fields.summary: Changeset display not showing HTML entities correctly

fields.description:
When logging in through https://bitbucket.org, I get a warning in both Chrome and FF about the SSL cert. It's been like this for a while, thought I'd mention it.

Text of warning in Chrome...

*This is probably not the site you are looking for!*

You attempted to reach api.bitbucket.org, but instead you actually reached a server identifying itself as bitbucket.org. This may be caused by a misconfiguration on the server or by something more serious. An attacker on your network could be trying to get you to visit a fake (and potentially harmful) version of api.bitbucket.org. You should not proceed.

Screenshot of FF attached.
fields.summary: HTTPS login certificate warning

fields.description: In the latest mercurial versions the ability to close branches was added, but bitbucket shows *all* branches, even closed with //hg commit --close-branch// - it can be a little annoying. Here is an example: http://bitbucket.org/brainerazer/closed-branches-test/. As you can see when you clone it, it has 2 branches, one of them is closed but bitbucket shows both in the //branches// menu. Fix it please.
fields.summary: Work with closed branches (BB-747)

fields.description: A plain/raw README at Source Browser doesn't show the first line. See a example in http://bitbucket.org/semente/bash/src/.
fields.summary: Missing the first line in README on Source Browser

fields.description:
bitbucket is great. But wouldnt it be greater, if it were OpenSource? On a developer platform are - of course - a lot of developers, who could help coding bitbucket.

So: Why is bitbucket ClosedSourceSoftware? rms would ask you, whether there is any "virus" or sth. like that here. I do not think so, but I cannot find any reasons for unfree software here.
fields.summary: Make it OpenSource

fields.description:
I have a free account. I have a private and a public repository. When editing repository settings for my public repository the checkbox "Private repository" is greyed out, since I have already used my one private repository allowed.

But after saving repository settings, the checkbox "Private repository" is not greyed out but clickable. Although it does not have an effect.

That is to say this bug is purely cosmetic. :)
fields.summary: gui glitch on Save repository settings

fields.description: If I fork somebody's code, i might want to fork their issue tracker as well. This is likely most useful when using "fork" in the classic sense ... splitting off a more-or-less permanent separate project.
fields.summary: Clone issues from another issue tracker

fields.description: I'd like to be able to subscribe a feed reader to the issue tracker. It doesn't seem to expose any feeds.
fields.summary: Add feeds for issue tracker queries (BB-746)

fields.description:
Hi there,

I think it would be really nice, if there were next to this issue tracker a "feature request tracker". On other platforms the feature request tracker is often used by the developers themselves to show what you can perhaps expect in the next versions.

Of course they could use the wiki instead of, but there wouldnt be a way to discuss the coming features really...

And so it would be nice if there were such a fq tracker - additionally and optionally of course. :)
fields.summary: make a difference between bugs an feature requests (BB-717)

fields.description:
Is there an easy way to customize the drop down lists for the state of an issue andd the type of an issue.\\
Currently we have type={enhancement,proposal,bug} but we would like (bug-H,bug-M,bug-L,enhancement,proposal} to easily classify the priority of a bug.\\
Also we need an additional state for an issue: fixed

It would be great if we can somehow configure the drop down lists in an easy way.
fields.summary: New Type and State for issues (BB-1013)

fields.description: if i upload an avatar of 35x35 it appears never as avatar in the author row of the overview or somewhere else! :-(
fields.summary: account avatar don't work!

fields.description:
Forks should not be mentioned with cnamed links or it will raise a 404.

E.g: http://code.welldev.org/djangorators/descendants/
fields.summary: Links broken for CNAME-ed forks
tstime: cannot create version.txt

fields.description: Dziesiejszego dnia próbując zalgowoać się na moje konto, wyskakiwał mi komunikat, że źle wpisuje hasło, ale ku mojemu zdziwieniu bez problemów mogę zalgować się na stronie, stworzyłem 2 account dla sprawdzenia czy uda mi się wbić i bez problemu zalogowałem się do gry.  Nick postaci Asgathar
fields.summary: Nie moge się zalogować na chara

fields.description: I have configured a CNAME, hg.arentz.ca, but it does not seem to work. When I go to http://hg.arentz.ca and login, I am correctly logged in but then redirected back to bitbucket.org. Isn't the CNAME there to make the whole site work under hg.arentz.ca? Or is it only used to make the HG repository available under a different name?
fields.summary: CNAME does not work

fields.description:
I have two accounts, 'st3fan' and 'arentz'. The latter is a paid account. When I log in to the arentz account, close my browser and come back after a little while, I am greeted with 'Welcome back st3fan'.

My browser is Safari. I've tried to delete all cookies from bitbucket.org but it does not help. Does Bitbucket use some other mechanism to identify the last used account? If so, it does not seem to work correctly with multiple accounts.
fields.summary: BitBucket Site does not remember last used account correctly

fields.description:
Some people don't seem to understand the "one click per link" concept of the internet: http://twitpic.com/lk86m

Would it be possible to collapse consecutive follow and unfollow events by the same user for the same repo into one news item to avoid cluttering the news feed?
fields.summary: Collapse multiple consecutive follows/unfollows into one news item

fields.description: When I follow a repo (my own, coveragepy), I get entries in the timeline when someone updates an issue, or comments on an issue, but not when they create an issue.  This seems odd: creating a new issue is a more significant event than a new comment.
fields.summary: Newly-created issues don't appear in the timeline

fields.description:
Upgrading from a paid plan to the free plan redirects to a paypal button and gives an error.

What I expected to see:\\
A notice that at the end of the current billing period my account would revert to the free option

What I saw instead:\\
A button to go to paypal to pay (wtf, seing as the free plan is - well - free)

Steps to reproduce:\\
Login to an account on the amature plan.\\
Click Plans in the menubar at the top of the window\\
Click on the choose button below the free column.
fields.summary: "Upgrading" to the free plan gives a paypal error

fields.description:
I added the FogBugz service using the Admin tap on my repository. The CVSSubmit url looks like https://myaccount.fogbugz.com.

No changesets that are pushed to my repo on bitbucket add links to FogBugz.

I tested FogBugz to make sure it was working by creating a local repo on my machine with the attached python script (provided from FogBugz) in the hgext folder.

When changesets are pushed to the local repo, the links are added to the FogBugz OnDemand system. This leads me to believe there is an issue with the bitbucket FogBugz service and not FogBugz OnDemand.

The necessary Mercurial settings for the local repo (hgrc file) follow:

[extensions]\\
hgext.fogbugz=\\
[hooks]\\
incoming=python:hgext.fogbugz.hook\\
[fogbugz]\\
host=https://myaccount.fogbugz.com\\
[web]\\
baseurl=http://bitbucket.org/myaccount/webfactory-dev
fields.summary: FogBugz Service not working with FogBug7 OnDemand (BB-745)

fields.description: on buy fuel page trying to get quotation using various postcodes. Only receiving 'invalid postcode' message
fields.summary: invalid postcode

fields.description:
I've noticed that, on a few of my projects, the first line of the (plain-text) README file isn't being shown. For example:

* http://bitbucket.org/wolever/reviewanywhere/src/
* http://bitbucket.org/wolever/say-thanks/src/
* http://bitbucket.org/wolever/django-amf-gateway/src/

Am I doin' something wrong? Or is this an actual bug?
fields.summary: First line of README isn't being shown

Hi I am trying to change my account name and cant do it. I am also trying to pay for my account to be continued but cant do it? Can anyone help? I had an employee who was handling this leave and I am new to the service.

Thanks

Jason Kingdon
fields.summary: help

fields.description:
Finetune control of access per repository is one great reason to use Bitbucket.

I am curious as to whether the team has considered adding the ability to manage groups of users and setting repository access based upon group access in addition to user access.

Working in a setting where we create many repositories during active development, it would be a time saver to simply add access for a group of specified users, rather than adding each user individually every time.
fields.summary: access control lists to include Groups of users (BB-53)

Thanks.

The request is that if the changeset is too large to display, then link each file to the url comparing the file in the changeset with its parent revision.

fields.description:
Hi there,

I just tried distribute-setup.py with python 3.1.1 and I get the following traceback:

{{{

File "distribute_setup.py", line 140\\
except pkg_resources.VersionConflict, e:\\
^\\
SyntaxError: invalid syntax

}}}

I ran 2to3 -w on it and it still failed with the following traceback:

{{{

Downloading http://pypi.python.org/packages/source/d/distribute/distribute-0.6.2.tar.gz\\
Extracting in /tmp/tmp3zpdM_\\
Traceback (most recent call last):\\
File "distribute_setup.py", line 428, in <module>\\
main(sys.argv[1:])\\
File "distribute_setup.py", line 424, in main\\
_install(tarball)\\
File "distribute_setup.py", line 72, in _install\\
extractall(tar)\\
File "distribute_setup.py", line 404, in extractall\\
directories.sort(sorter)\\
TypeError: must use keyword argument for key function

}}}

With the 0.6.2 release supporting Python 3, I thought I should mention issue.

Thanks for the great work!\\
Krys Lawrence\\
krys at krys dot ca
fields.summary: distribute-setup.py does not work with Python 3.1.1

fields.description:
Actually pattern of branch uri is

/username/projectname/src/lastrevisionofbranc/

so uri change each time we update it we have to warn people each time branch is updated to give them the new url. Imo it may be better to have

/username/projectname/branch/branchname/

So we can rely on it each time we have.
fields.summary: named branch url (BB-742)

without the gl=IL&hl=en parameters parsing the url succeeds.

Also, not sure if it's related, but the space this repo is using is not counted in my account usage (it's my largest by far, so I'd notice). The files seem to be there though, and I'm not getting any errors.

When you download a snapshot of a repository at a given tag, any subrepo content isn't included.  This makes those snapshots pretty much useless.

fields.summary: Author encoding issue

fields.description:
Hi there, this is a feature request that would really help us out (and I'm sure many other customers).

Currently the only status values available are "new", "open", "invalid", "duplicate", "wontfix" and "resolved".  When we fix bugs as a team, we assign the bug status to "resolved".  However, it's a tester's job to come along and review the "resolved" bugs to make sure they're really resolved.  As it is, the tester can't assign any reasonable status to the bug to indicate that it's been tested.  How about letting us have custom statuses, e.g. "fixed", or "checked in"?

:)\\
Jason
fields.summary: Not a bug but a feature request: custom issue statuses

fields.description:
The current version of Django and python-markdown support the {{{[TOC]}}} macro to insert a table of contents.  This is really handy for larger READMEs.

Here's an example of how I use it on my site: http://bitbucket.org/sjl/stevelosh/src/tip/templates/projects/project.html#cl-34

fields.description:
Last night, all of our commits were retroactively assigned to a different user.

I suspect this may be because the new user (a generic user created as an umbrella for a subteam) shared an email address with the original author.

Are commits mapped to users solely by email address?
fields.summary: All commits reassigned to a different author! (BB-537)

fields.description:
There appears to be a usability issue with reporting bugs in the correct issue tracker: each page of issues in the issue tracker for the Bitbucket website has one or more invalid issues that actually belong to a project hosted here.

It seems people see the "Report Bug" link at the bottom and think that it's related to the repository they're currently viewing.

I propose renaming that link to "Report Bug in Website" to indicate that it's really for this website and not the currently displayed project. Hopefully, people will then take a second look and discover the Issues link at the top.
fields.summary: Rename link at bottom of each page for reporting bugs

fields.description: We committed mods to several hundred files in a private repo. The detail displays a file list followed by individual diffs, 50 files in all. The raw changeset is similarly truncated.  The changeset summary (on a separte page) shows "50+", but there is no indication on the detail page. This is misleading. By contrast, the detail for the initial commit (full files before the mods), did warn that the changeset was too large to display. This is just an anomaly in bitbucket's presentation. The repo itself is correct, and after pulling it, my local logs reflect the actual commit.
fields.summary: Changeset detail truncates without warning
